intro: Acidoton phyllanthoides, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval or elliptic in shape. It is often found in rocky or wooded areas and thrives in well-drained soils. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
